dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is falling in a forgotten part of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street-lights are a joke - three out of four are dead Only a large moon and some cloud-streaked stars illuminat dark and derelict street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the hub of an industrial area, now the buildings are abandoned, the sidewalks choked with litter and debris. are boarded-up, windows are glassless, walls are graffiti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At various points, several BUMS warm their hands at trash fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as their eyes move, following something moving down the street.  Heard OFF is the sound of a smooth and powerful engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down this boulevard of decay and despair drives an incongruously expensive car - a Range Rover. A rich kid i going shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car cruises the ruins until it pulls up outside the o open store on the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim light bulb shines within - the only indicator that store is still trading.  Its windows are grimy, its door defaced.  Above the door - barely legible through the acc dirt of city years - a sign; CARDUCCI'S ANTIQUES AND CURI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side door opens - helped on its way by the kick of an expensive leather boot - and JP MONROE steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP is 24, rich, handsome, and spoiled. His hair is slick designer-grease, his slim frame is wrapped in a $600 leat jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment he surveys the store and casts contemptuous glances up and down the ruined street.  He shows no anxie being in this twilight part of town.  Cocooned in the confidence of wealth, he's never felt threatened in his l Satisfied he's in the right place, he walks confidently t the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store itself looks like an antique - old wood panelli shelving, Victorian display cases, and faded wallpaper. grimy, dusty, and dimly-lit - and apparently unattended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is packed with merchandise - shelves and aisles overfl onto the floor making the place a maze to walk through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock is a strange surreal mix.  Discarded items from America (Norge fridges, toasters, Frankie Lymon albums) s space with older items; framed pictures, Victorian automa wax dolls, and (a specialty of the store?) items of punis stocks, iron boots, chastity belts, whips. Could that rea be an Electric Chair glimpsed in the shadowed back of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders through the merchandise, casting appraising gl at some items.  Some he even runs his hands over - grimac the dust and grime they leave on his fingers.  But his ma suggests he is looking for something specific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the room's center is an old hoarding from the dead d vaudeville and travelling shows.  It is tall and broad an leaning against something behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - which is colorfully and garishly decorated and full of hyperbolic come-ons to long-dead punters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as he moves the hoarding aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALED is a six-foot tall black rectangular pillar, cov in beautifully detailed 3-D carvings all in the same matt finish as the pillar itself.  The pillar is extremely biz as if a New York avant-garde sculptor has interpreted a T Pole for jaded modern tastes.  The carvings are of dead r copulating skeletons,  filigree-patterned boxes, and face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these faces - recognizable to the audience but not - is the ossified visage of PINHEAD, the demon from the f two HELLRAISER pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as he leans in to study this face, already fascinated b calm cruelty and promise of dark wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice OFF startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP whirls round in shock.  A BUM is standing close to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has long matted black hair and a similarly greasy bear His eyes are a piercing, excited blue.  Otherwise he is indistinguishable from those we saw on the street outside ragged, tatty clothes, features blackened with grime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as he glances round the store and past the bum to the d beyond; has this character just wandered in from the stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bum smiles, shaking his head knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not mine.  Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP nods, still a little uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you want for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you think its worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP digs a hand into his back pocket and pulls out a wad o cash.  Without counting or checking, he proffers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bum's hand flies out and siezes JP's, pressing the mo between their palms, making the exchange into a handclasp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, OUT OF FOCUS, is Pinhead's face on the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FOCUS switches so that the hands in foreground BLUR a Pinhead's frozen face becomes SHARP, as if he is silently watching this deal take place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bum's hand moves away with the money as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKNESS.   Voice OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mystery to me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH-CUT to full-frame VIDEO IMAGE image of JOANNE SUMMERSKILL, standing and looking directly into camera, a we are watching a TV broadcast.  In shot behind her is a hospital Emergency Room - no patients, no staff, just bed intensive-care equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne - or JOEY, as she prefers to be called - is 23 yea old, an attractive and clever brunette, with a quiet sadn her eyes that she usually manages to keep almost hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in the stylish but sedate garb of a TV newsperson holds a microphone marked with the logo of her station, W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her direct address to the unseen TV camera continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most nights this inner-city Emergency Room would be a chaos of blood and panic and grace under pressure.  But tonight, as you see, it's like Death took a holiday.  It's a mystery to me ... A mystery how those assholes at Assignments knew it.  This is Joey Summerskill for W-QQY.  Emergency Room. No story.  Really, really pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the nature of her last few words, Joey has ironic kept up the manner and delivery of a newscaster.  Now, sh breaks mood, looks away from the camera, and, with a dism wave of the hand, begins to walk out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, break it down, Doc.  It's a bust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - to reveal that we are not watching a broadcast at all b are in the ER in real time.  As well as Joey, the room co her cameraman ("DOC" FISHER) and an ER NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc - a 45 year old with a weight problem, a nicotine addiction, and a cynical attitude - lowers a shoulder-mou Video camera and watches Joey walk to a water-cooler agai wall. His expression is a mix of exasperation and sympath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse is a middle-aged woman of Asian ancestry.  She puzzled expression as she addresses Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can talk like this on television? She can say this thing?  This assholes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc replies but keeps his eyes on Joey as he crosses to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat, sweetheart.  It's for the European satellite ....  Joey; rein it in, kid.  They couldn't've known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sucks angrily at water from a paper-cup and then cru and bins the cup like an act of revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know.  But it's just so ... neat, isn't it?  The first gig that isn't cute kids or diet gurus and it's taken away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well like you said - it's a mystery.  But that's all it is. Mystery.  Not malice.  What, you think the station paid off every accident victim in the city to ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc is interrupted by the RINGING of a cell-phone he has holstered at his waist.  He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc.  24th and Cedar.  Fast.  Hostage situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.  Listen - Joey's here.  Shall ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need.  Martin's already there. Hurry.  You've got ambulances to beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead.  Doc looks at Joey.  She heard it all shrugs apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better hurry, Doc.  A real story.  With a real reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey ....  Look, you wanna ride?  I can go by your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd lose the money-shots.  No.  I'll catch a bus.  Or a cab.  Don't worry about it.  Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.  Be careful.  And lighten up.  Story of your life could be right round the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the story of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a rueful smile, Joey watches Doc leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and the Nurse exchange glances - Joey's impassive bu vaguely friendly, the Nurse's a little disapproving; if t camera's gone, what the hell are YOU still doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey makes her solitary way along a medium-length corrido that has two sets of double swing doors at either end, on giving on to the ER, the other toward an exit.  Joey is h for the latter, her mood sad and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly - SMASH! - the doors burst open from the other s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is suddenly fast and urgent as a gurney is wheel rapidly through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two PARAMEDICS, both male, both about Joey's age, are pus the gurney at a run and talking rapidly to each other.  T completely ignore Joey and also ignore the TEENAGE GIRL w running beside the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl - TERRI - is 18 or 19.  She is a pale-faced blon dressed as if for a Desperately-Seeking-Susan party and i keeping up a stream of chatter as if rehearsing excuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joey flattens herself against the corridor wall to let pass, it is neither the paramedics nor Terri that get her attention.  It is the BOY on the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teenage boy lies flat on his back semi-conscious, his eyelids fluttering, his breathing shallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horribly, shockingly, dangling from his face and body are heavy chains that drag and rattle along the corridor floo There are at least sixteen of them and they seem firmly b in his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIALOGUE as the gurney is rushed to the ER doors is R FIRE and OVERLAPPED, the Paramedics responding only to ea other and ignoring the two girls comments and questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault.  It wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 milligram IV Valium stat.  How the fuck did this happen ... ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was outside.  I wasn't even with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see anything like this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have stolen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  Five times a fucking day. Just push!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the gurney has passed her, Joey runs along behind it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was off the statue.  In the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think they'll get him back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst case of status I've seen.  Even money at best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foot of the gurney slams into the ER doors and the Paramedics slide it rapidly through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  I'm a reporter!  Tell me where he was ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse and a middle-aged DOCTOR are seen through the d preparing emergency equipment.  The Doctor already has fibrillator pads in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paramedics follow the gurney through and, turning rap push the doors closed from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Terri are alone, excluded from the ER activity. turns to speak but Terri is already halfway to the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  Hold on, please.  I need talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) It's nothing to do with me.  I wasn't even with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey catches up with her a couple of yards short of the d She grabs at her arm to slow her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri turns, snatching her arm away in a sudden moment of anger.  She backs toward the doors, making gestures of dismissal and denial with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, lady!  I told you!  It's not my problem!  I was just there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under The Underground.  Can I like GO now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the Underground?  What's that? Where is ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the conversation is interrupted by a shattering loud SCREAM, agonized and terrified, coming from the ER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both girls freeze but then their reactions are very diffe Joey turns instantly and runs back toward the ER.  Terri watches her for a beat and then heads through the other d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM continues, a howling horrible sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey reaches the ER doors and throws them open.  And free terrified shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - is on the floor, as if flung there by some powerful for The fibrillator pads are still in his hands and his expre is awe-struck and disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - is cowering behind a mobile tray of surgical instrument muttering to herself and making the gesture of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - are flattened against the far wall, terror on their fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy is on the emergency table.  It's him that's screa His body is arched tight in shock, eyes and mouth wide op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wired up to an ECG and the MONITOR shows a heartbeat should be measured on the Richter scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chains - all still connected to his face and his body rigid and tight, being pulled straight up into the air as tugged taut by invisible hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy's skin is stretched and pulled at those points wh the chains are connected to him and it seems horribly pos that his flesh will burst if the pressure continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene is held for a terrible frozen moment.  Then sud the chains drop, the scream stops, and the boy's body slu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a massive ELECTRICAL SURGE.  The ECG flat-lines it and the other monitors go haywire, sparking and splutt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the room flicker and strobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fibrillator pads arc angrily. The Doctor flings them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELECTRIC ENERGY seems to run along the slumped chains and disappear as if dissolved in some impossible electric mel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighting and machinery return to normal (ECG still flat-l and the medical staff stare thunder-struck at the dead bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, the other people in the ER become awa Joey's presence in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?  Get her out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse heads for the doors.  Joey is already backing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Joey backs away, an expression of numbed shock on he face.  The doors close over, blocking her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - still arcing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on flickering neon light in the bus cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - glancing at the light from her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is almost deserted.  Three other passengers - A P BAG LADY, and A WINO - are spread out around the interior seem lost in worlds of their own but their vacant alienat stares highlight Joey's isolation and tension.  Fear has entered her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus moves through the neon-lit loneliness of downtown streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - her face, lit by reflected store-signs and street-light lost and distant, as if she is submerged in some dream-se memory and sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of TV monitors, each monitor showing Joey sitting couch with a painfully thin older woman - BRITTANY VERTUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brittany's probably 50 but her face is as tight and smoot surgery can make it.  She is dressed in the standard unif the health-avatar; brightly-colored leotard over black ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey has a big paperback book - BEYOND HUNGER; THE BRITTA VERTUE GUIDE TO HOLISTIC DIETING - which she holds to cam She smiles and, turning to face Brittany, crosses her leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image freezes.  And replays.  Joey crosses her legs a And again.  And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over) See?  This is what I mean.  Your technique is all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey (in real time) is sitting in an easy chair in the ed suite looking at the wall of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD, a techie in his late-twenties, and DOC FISHER are i swivel chairs immediately in front of the video console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three are drinking coffee.  Doc is smoking a cigarett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guardedly) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean hardly any thigh.  I'm telling you, Joey; shorter skirt, more lift on the leg-cross ... and you're made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc chuckles in a half-friendly, half-sleazy way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think I'm kidding?  I guarantee it.  An inch more flank.  Boys upstairs get hot.  Bingo, you're an anchor-woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Jesus Christ ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, give her a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc leans over and stops the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doc) What's with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swivels his chair round to face Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Joey.  I'm just trying to help you hit a home run here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well, you just struck out.  It may be a surprise to you, Brad, but I want to do it the right way.  Not tight skirts.  Tight stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Like last night's doozie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I believe what you say.  But this is TV.  No pictures, no story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, too bad I had to go and ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and cover something on Planet Earth. See, you gotta remember, Joey; this is a LOCAL station.  As in local to this galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey slams her coffee mug down and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a story out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in warningly) Not on station time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not on station time.  My story.  My time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey exits.  Brad watches her leave with a half-smile on face then turns to Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of attitude there, Doc ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts up the video tape again and, on the monitors, J once again crosses her legs on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but great legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a screaming male face, twisted as in pain or fur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK rapidly to REVEAL the face belongs to the lead of THANATOS.  He is on a nightclub stage with the rest of band, all of them dressed in that shit-poor-white-trash-o look favored by all such rich young businessmen with guit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tatty banner across the back of the stage proclaims: UN THE UNDERGROUND PRESENTS THANATOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM ends, replaced with the roaring thunder of dru guitars as Thanatos kick into some thrash-metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance-floor of the club is packed with KIDS dancing t incredibly fast, incredibly loud music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of the kids favor the same look as the band but it's exclusive; college types are there too, along with some В and female - sporting the glitz-meets-sleaze look of Terr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club itself is of course dimly-lit and the basic deco black.  Where it is distinguished from hundreds of others the bizarre sculptures and pieces of artwork that hang fr ceiling and walls, all in tones of black, silver and gray

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A headless, armless torso wrapped in barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of male and female heads.  Bonsai-like trees grow every orifice - eye-sockets, nostrils, ears, and mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A human arm with the skin and flesh of its upper half pee open and pinned out to reveal inside - instead of bone an sinew - an entire miniature metropolis, beautifully detai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black bird cage containing a fetal skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids also crowd the bar and the tables on the outskirts o dance floor.  It is a hot, sweaty, faintly aggressive atmosphere - people jostling for position, shouting to be heard, etc etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera finds Joey - incongruous by dress and demeanor pushing her way among the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is too loud and overpowering to hear Joey's voi it is clear as she moves through the confines of the club she is approaching various people and enquiring after Ter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - shake their heads and shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - stares blankly and blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - giggle, purse their lips, shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - catches sight of a blonde figure moving across the danc floor and pushes through the crowd to follow.  She taps t figure's arm but, as it turns, she realizes it is a man В 70's revivalist GLITTER-ROCKER.  He looks quizzically at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's mouth moves and this time she seems to get some response.  The Glitter-Rocker mouths a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey can't hear him.  She hands him a business card and a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrawls a name on the back of the card and Joey nods h thanks as he moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Joey reads the name "Terri" on it.  She flips the ca reveal her name and number and writes "Terri - Please cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Joey pushes to the counter and hands the card to a B who looks at it, nods, and puts it beneath the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Joey makes her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera moves into the tightly-packed throng on the dance making its way slowly toward the previously unseen center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts slightly to reveal, in the direct center floor, the tall black pillar from the opening sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillar is mounted on a plinth and spins as the client dance around it.  It seems very in keeping with the decor the club but even so it is a strong unsettling presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillar has been mounted upside down, so that it looks odder than our first glimpse of it.  Near the bottom the inverted face of Pinhead, black and frozen, can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera begins to spin around the pillar in contrary m to the pillar's own movement and, as it does so, draws cl and closer making for a disorienting, vertiginous image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As this happens, the raucous sound of the band Thanatos b to fade into a whirl of ECHO and to be replaced by a whir spinning, sound which we only recognize fully as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is filled with dense jungle foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chugging spinning sound is now identifiable as the so Helicopter blades, one element of a SOUND MONTAGE conveyi sense and feel of a Jungle War; Helicopters in flight, ma gun fire, distant explosions, confused shouts and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POV camera pushes its way through the lush, humid green

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera seems to be searching for something, glancing way and that, shoving leaves and tall grass aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voices begin to emerge clearly from the SOUND MASS off-sc as if the unseen seeker is getting nearer to his or her g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Call for a Medi-Vac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Don't die, man!  Don't fucking die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dialogue prompts a more furious effort on the part of POV camera.  Pushing frantically through the obscuring fo it finally gains a clearer view and stops, looking ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a tiny clearing, ten feet from the camera, still parti obscured by the jungle, two camouflage-clad SOLDIERS lean the prone body of a third.  It is unclear due to distance there is a lot of blood on the Soldier's body and uniform

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new sound joins the SOUND MONTAGE - a persistent, rhyth ringing sound.  The other elements die away until only th left and we recognize it as the sound of a telephone as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey jerks upright in bed as the ringing continues.  Conf and disoriented, her eyes fly around her darkened bedroom she's trying to understand where she is and what is happe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, she registers the phone and leans toward her bed table to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - favoring the luminous display of an alarm clock next to phone.  Its warm green figures show the time is 2:35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off. Sleepily) God.  This better be birth, marriage, or death ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she picks up the handset and puts it to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Uh ... Hi!  Is this ... er ... Joanne Summerskill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey.  Yeah, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like ... left me a card?  At the club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey swings out of bed to sit on the edge, much more aler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right ... So ... Well, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.  We met ... now, listen, don't hang up, OK? ... We met at the hospital last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  Yeah.  Well ... Look, I'll make a deal with you ... My boyfriend threw me out, right?  I'll trade you. You give me couch-space.  I'll give you talk.  OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey can't resist another glance at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure.  You mean ... tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Surprised at Joey's surprise. Bit of a culture clash here) Of course tonight.  Is that a problem? Like, if you've got a guy there or something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  It's fine.  Come now.  I was having bad dreams anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the front door of the apartment as it opens to r Terri leaning against the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clad identically to how we last saw her, Terri clutches a stuffed leather bag, containing all her worldly possessio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not waiting for either reply or invitation, she moves for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Terri walks past the dressing-gowned Joey and heads straight for Joey's sofa and sprawls on it, laying her ba the floor beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey closes the door, raised eyebrows registering her sli disapproval at Terri's cavalier attitude.  Her voice, how is polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put some decaf on.  Er ... make yourself comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey walks past Terri and through to her kitchen, from wh hear the sound of COFFEE BEING POURED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri looks around at Joey's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large and spacious room suggests that even if Joey is dissatisfied with her job she's at least being paid enoug make it bearable.  The room is very ordered, very neat, b stops short of being prissy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very large picture window takes up all of one wall.  At moment of course the drapes are closed.  Another wall is up by a huge shelf unit packed with books, videos, and CD Joey's obsession with "getting the whole story" seems to true of her personal life as well as her professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - having finished her quick examination, she calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... what was your bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey re-enters, carrying two mugs of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dream.  You said you were having a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands one coffee to Terri and sits opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... well, I've been having it for years. It's not a nightmare or anything.  It's ... well, I know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, it's OK.  I ... It's my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic, knowing) Oh, right.  Did he used to ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, no!  Nothing like that.  No, he died before I was born.  He died in Vietnam.  I never knew him.  Never met him.  We don't even know the details.  I dream of battlefields.  Of searching. Of trying to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ... I mean, it's not like great about your dad or anything.  It's just I don't dream.  Never have.  ... Maybe it'd help if I slept sometime ... Just kidding ... No, so it's always neat for me to hear about dreams.  I'm jealous.  It's like everybody has another world except me. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're saying but ... Never? You've never had a dream?  No, you know, you do.  You must.  What you mean is you don't remember them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.  All I know is - this is it for me.  Just me, my bag, and a series of shithead boyfriends.  It'd be good to see something else.  Have a nighttime life.  Be somebody different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri pauses, then smiles like she's just realized someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ... this is great, isn't it?  Just girls talking.  Like having a conversation?  Good coffee.  You got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey waits, letting herself catch up with Terri's good-na but marginally strung-out personality.  She looks around room as if trying to remember where there are cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh ...  yeah.  Yeah, somewhere.  Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey crosses to the big shelf-unit and pulls out a concea pack of cigarettes, a Zippo lighter, and an ashtray from a shelf of videos.  We notice that the videos are THE WOR WAR, volumes 1 thru 26.  She brings the smokes to Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Thanks.  You gonna have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go on.  Have one.  Fuck it.  You think you're going to live forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and proffers the pack to Joey who shrugs, smil and takes one.  Terri picks up the Zippo and sparks it. A FLAME leaps out of the lighter, producing an instant of t from Terri.  Joey pulls the lighter back from Terri and c the lid extinguishing the flame.  Terri draws a book of m from her pocket shakily attempts to light her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  It was my father's.  It's temperamental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  It's just someone burned me once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes the book of matches from Terri's hands and lig both cigarettes.  Terri takes a long, fearful look at the burning flame and then takes a deep, calming drag of her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna know how I look at it?  Way I see it is ... you give up, right?  Three days later, you get hit by a fucking truck and you know - you just KNOW В– that your last thought as you go under those wheels'd be "Jesus H. Christ, I coulda smoked another three packs!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays the book of matches down.  Joey's eyes go to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black letters on the dark-grey cover: UNDER THE UNDERGROU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri's eyes flick to the match-book and her mood changes becoming subdued and a little sullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You wanna talk about that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.  Terri, something awful happened to that boy.  I have to find out what it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know anything!  Really.  I just came out of the club and the kid was already in the street.  He ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'd seen him in there a few times before.  He was just a punk.  I'd never like danced with him or anything. Anyway, he was a thief.  He must've taken it from the statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing!  He was lying there in the street, moaning.  But he pointed at it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  He was already ... wounded ... when you found him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  That's what I'm saying!  And it was lying next to him.  And he pointed at it before he passed out and ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Wait.  The chains.  Where did the chains come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to tell you! ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri rummages in her bag, getting hold of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said they came out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her hand out and the camera TRACKS in to meet i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resting on her palm is a black cube about 4 inches square has the same matt-black carbonized look as the pillar and recognizable as one of the "carvings" we saw on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is fine filigree pattern-work over each of its surf and, to audiences familiar with the HELLRAISER movies, th is recognizable despite its black coating; it is the Lame Configuration, the puzzle box that opens the doors to Hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a stubby shard of material protruding from one s the box - presumably where the boy from ER had broken it the pillar.  Camera favors this jagged shard as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY CLOSE on its upper left section.  We are looking at in the pillar that matches the pattern of the shard on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is empty.  The dim lighting of working hours has replaced with the sickly gleam of one or two fluorescent and the club has that eerie not-quite-right look that all places have when subjected to a harsher light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two WORKERS are in the final stages of clearing the night debris - emptying trash into big black plastic bags, wipi down tables and bars etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work completed, they head to the main exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them hits the light switches so that the fluoresce clarity is again replaced by the more appropriate dim lig The other shouts across the apparently deserted club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done, Mr. Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand a second but no response comes.  The first tur the second and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing silently) Ass hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His co-worker grins and they let themselves out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Another door opens into the club and JP Monroe В club's owner and the man we saw buy the pillar -  walks i the main room of the club from his private room at the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP walks out into the shadowed darkness of his small king He describes a circle around the dance floor, throwing gl at his odd sculptures, and finally walks into the center room to stand before the pride of his collection, the pil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillar of course is stationary at this time, though i still mounted upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP smiles possessively at the pillar - and then registers mutilation where the Box has been ripped away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in closer to stare at the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, jarringly, there is a quiet but distinct SQUEAK seems to come from within the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP starts back a little, a small expression of anxiety on normally supercilious face.  He glances to right and left a grip, and leans forward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as, again, the noise comes.  Is it a squeak - or is it creaking shifting of hidden machinery, hidden chains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP's hand moves tentatively into shot, approaching the ho Slowly, slowly, it reaches wrist-deep into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY CLOSE on JP's face - quizzical, enquiring ... and su contorted in pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaahh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as JP's hand whips out of the hole, shaking in shock an pain.  A rat is hanging on to one of JP's fingers, its sh teeth buried in the flesh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP swings his arm violently through the air, dislodging t with the force of his swing.  A spray of blood is seen to from JP's wounded finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as it lands heavily in a shadowed corner of the club an scurries away deeper into the darkness, squeaking furious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as he looks down at his finger, face snarling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY CLOSE.  Blood seeps from the tiny teeth marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP's voice is cut off by a strange SIZZLING NOISE heard O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP's face moves up to look at the pillar.  A look of awe shock crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some small drops of blood stand out bright red on the bla of the pillar.  The sizzling noise is coming from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the drops draw together magically into one large of blood - already larger than possibility would allow. it gets wierder; the blood suddenly dissipates into six o seven little rivulets that begin to run down the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streams of blood don't simply fall straight.  They se follow some pre-gouged pattern, running down the pillar t the blackened organic contours of the carvings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all culminate at the point of Pinhead's chin - and t separate again, running over his frozen black face along carved scar lines that make a matrix across his features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When every canal line on the demon's face is filled neatl blood, a BLUE LIGHT seems to glow from within the pillar through Pinhead's face, giving it temporarily the blue to had enjoyed in (un)life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on his awe-struck face - bathed in reflected blue l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as gradually the blueness subsides again, the visible b vanishing with it, leaving the same frozen implacable bla as before but charged now with a waiting power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frying pan sits atop a burner.  it contains the ugliest of scrambled eggs you have ever seen ... or perhaps it's omelette.  There are other ingredients in there but they' burnt so black they're unrecognizable.  At least half of mixture lies all over the stove top instead of in the pan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Did I sleep through an earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - showing the chaos all around the kitchen: Spilled flour work surfaces; Egg-shells on the linoleum; A knocked-over of orange juice, the juice soaking into a piece of kitche roll; Coffee as black and thick as a mix of Indian ink an molasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, in her dressing-gown, stands in the doorway with a shocked expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, in an oversized man's shirt, stands by the stove h a fish-slice and smiling nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured I'd make breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right ... That's ... er ... that's nice of you, Terri.  Can I ask?  Is it always this ... exploratory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!  I don't know yet.  First time. Kitchen virgin, that's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey nods slowly, crossing to a cabinet and taking out so instant coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll boil some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No, that's OK.  I like to.  I love boiling water.  It's a specialty of mine.  Why don't you go watch cartoons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey watches Terri walk out of the kitchen, sighs in reli and grabs the kettle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sits, drinking her coffee, as Terri walks round the with hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great.  And it's yours?  You like own it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank owns it.  But I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, I've never owned anything.  I haven't even had a room of my own since I was fifteen years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How have you ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys.  Sometimes friends.  Mostly guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri walks past Joey's TV set (sound down, cartoons play

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Box is on top of the TV.  In the warm light of mornin seems innocuous and harmless, like just another ornament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Terri walks on, pausing by the shelves of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  Lotta books.  You read all these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I buy them to impress people.  Of course I've read them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.  I read a book once.  It was like all these people discovering who they used to be.  You know, like reincarnation?  It was really good.  You ever read that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  But it's a fascinating subject.  Did you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Terri has already moved on.  She is by the big pictur window.  The drapes are now open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great view!  Great view!  Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stands and walks to join Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm pretty familiar with the view ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's apartment is on a high floor and her window overlo many lower buildings, giving a view of the city beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) ... but it is good.  You know, over to the left, you can ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to right and pointing) Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the flat roof of a nearby building, a RETARDED TEENAGE sits motionless in an old rusty deck chair next to a smal Jerry-built pigeon coop.  Its door is open and it is empt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is some distance from the girls but his solitude, stillness, and the empty coop beside him lend the scene a atmosphere of sadness and loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joey tells his story, we INTERCUT between the POV of t roof and the girls at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know his name ...  I saw the whole story.  A wounded bird was on his roof.  I could hear its cries from here. He went straight to it.  I couldn't've. I'd be frozen between pity and fear. But he wasn't.  Its pain spoke directly to him.  He picked it up.  Nursed it. Fed it.  And it got better.  Everyday he'd watch the pigeon.  Everyday the pigeon would watch him. I saw him learn. Learn that there was one more thing he had to do to make the rescue complete. And one day, just as afternoon became evening, he leaned over, opened the cage, and walked away.  Didn't look back.  But he heard the sound of its wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he still sits there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he thinks it'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He knows it won't.  It was his final act of love and part of him knows that and part of him doesn't yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!  He should've kept it.  It'd live longer!  It's dangerous out there! People get hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she realizes she has a wounded pigeon of her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  I wasn't talking about ... I ... Do you want to stay?  You want to stay here for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri shrugs, gives a nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey crosses to the TV, picks up the Box and weighs it in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.  OK.  It's a done deal.  But look В– you have to help me.  I've got to solve this thing.  I've got to know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri follows across the room and sits on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not.  But you know more than I do. You know something about this box. Something about a statue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I found it.  I knew held like it and I figured ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah.  Wait a minute.  Who?  The kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  JP.  My last boyfriend?  He like owns the club.  You know?  You were there?  He bought the statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you found.  What do you mean you found it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was downtown looking for a ... a friend.  A guy I know.  Anyway, there was this store.  Like real old?  Lotsa weird shit in there.  I saw this statue. Pillar.  Thing.  I knew he'd love it. You've seen the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you know this store again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Saturday morning.  Let's go shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's Mazda 323 drives down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The daylight street is still creepy but in a different wa bums, no trash-can fires, nothing.  It has the feel of a town, as if nothing has breathed here for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, at the wheel, has a disbelieving look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, smoking, flicks ash through her wound-down window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  Are you sure this is the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Happening, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth were you doing down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evasive silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buying some drugs, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Terri ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For somebody else, alright?  Not for me. I don't do that shit anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't even be around it. You know, it's ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!  Here!  Pull over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey brings the car to a halt outside the antique store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri scrambles out of the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  See.  I told you it was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she looks at Terri from behind, her face worried for new and screwed-up friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.   CARDUCCIВ’S ANTIQUES   DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Terri enter the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store is different, its selection of merchandise redu The 50's and 60's junk hardware is still there, along wit of the more mundane Victoriana, but it seems more "normal none of the odd items of punishment memorabilia are there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, because it is daylight, the store seems merely old, interesting, and musty, not creepy or odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There seems to be no-one in attendance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Another offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP doesn't respond.  He draws a double-barrelled shotgun the bag, cocks it, and loads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP turns to face the pillar, drawing a bead on Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead's expression is wearily amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm touched ... That is the gun you used to kill your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP visibly staggers as Pinhead lets slip this knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  Their fortune was so tempting, their affection so conditional.  What else could you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the double trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive BLAST resounds around the room but that's about the 30 ott six is absorbed magically into the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Now, shall we talk sensibly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP lets the useless gun fall from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flee from yourself.  If you have a quality, let it define you.  Cultivate it.  It is you.  By helping me, you will help yourse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?  What are you talking about?  Why should I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you want to.  You've always wanted to.  Look at your pictures.  Look at your sculptures.  Look at those tawdry representations and then ... Imagine.  Imagine a world of the body as canvas.  The body as clay.  Your will and mine as the brush and the knife. Oh, I have such sights to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working.  JP's eyes are glittering with excited inte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark star rising.  I was bound to another's system by a soul I once possessed.  A friend relieved me of that inconvenience.  Now I'm free.  Born again of Blood and Desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's what makes the world go round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead raises an amused eyebrow at JP's little joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, we're not so dissimilar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how in God's name ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God?  My God was diamond and black light.  And I was his Dark Pope.  All that is changed.  A terrible beauty is born.  With a place at my right hand for a man of your tastes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP cruises the room, contemplating this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has already begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many screens fill the frame, all of them crackling with s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is alone at the control desk.  She has a video tape hand and feeds it into the master machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at the still-ghosting monitors and then pres few buttons on the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow is replaced by blackness on every monitor with a code ticking away at the bottom of each screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Alright ... Let's see what we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blackness on the monitors gives way to multiple image KIRSTY, the girl in the picture in the antique store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video image is primitive, shot with a non-professiona camcorder, and is a simple medium long-shot of Kirsty, dr in a simple white smock, sitting in a hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty addresses the camera directly, though occasionally up to the side as if speaking to an unseen doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT through Kirsty's monologue between: A single mon image, the wall of monitors, and the watching and listeni Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) I don't know what the Box is.  But I know what it does.  I ...    (looks up to side)     I've said all this before. Do you ...    (blinks, nods, as if listening.  Looks back to camera)  I saw it open.  I opened it.  I saw what came out.  I don't know what else to call them.  Demons.  Demons live in the box. Or come through the box from somewhere else.  It's a gateway to Hell.  Or the South Bronx.     (smiles ruefully at her own joke.  Looks up to side as if chastised for kidding around.  Nods. Continues)     I know you don't believe me.  I know what it sounds like.  But what else ... Jesus, talk to Ronson, talk to the other cops.  They saw the house.  They saw my ... my father ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty breaks down into sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - whose expression shows distressed sympathy.  She too ha lost her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video image breaks up into white noise and then comes in, as if the camcorder was turned off for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the image returns, Kirsty is smoking a cigarette to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) Solving the puzzle means opening the box.  Opening the box means opening doors.  And there are some doors you don't want to open.  And it may be metaphorical to you, Doctor, but you haven't had some blue-faced bastard come at you with hooks and chains.  It isn't delusion, it isn't psychosis.  It's reality.  It's reality.     (Pause. Long drag on the cigarette?)   Maybe not this reality ... but there are others. I've seen them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's face shows horrified fascination at Kirsty's story There is a conviction in the telling which is working on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dimly-lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is littered with video-boxes and tapes.  Other are piled on top of the VCR.  It's like somebody has been viewing constantly for a week and hasn't put anything awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many books are lying on the sofa, the table, and the floo Some are lying open, most are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also on the coffee table are three different soft-drink c half- empty cup of coffee, and a very full ash-tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri is standing by the bookshelfs, running her eyes and finger along some titles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we understand the chaos in the room.  Terri's home al She's bored and trying to find something to hold her inte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks away from the shelves and walks idly over to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Box is back on top of the TV.  Terri's hand hovers ne on/off switch of the TV.  Then it hesitates and picks up box instead.  Terri holds the box and looks at it.  Her f becomes puzzled and she crosses the room to flick on a LI She wanders back to the TV looking at the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks different.  Its edges are more sharply defined. shard where it was broken from the pillar is smaller, smo The detailed metal-work has some color back and is shinin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Joey musta polished you up some. Sometimes I think she's wierder than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri's voice trails off as she continues to look at the She turns it in her hands, running her fingers over its filigree surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK in slowly as she cups it in both hands, her eyes mo from puzzlement to fascination and concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rubs her thumbs over the designs.  TRACKING IN contin It's tense.  Is she going to try and work the puzzle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly .... BRRRRRRRRR ... the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri jumps in shock, nearly dropping the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the box back on top of the TV and crosses to the phone.  She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live and in the flesh.  How're you doing, babe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on JP's face as he speaks into a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, always questions.  What do I want? I don't want anything.  Just concerned about you.  Just checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.  How'd you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you relax?  Your little girlfriend left a card, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Yeah.  Yeah.  Well ... I'm fine. Things are great here.  Joey's going to get me a job at the TV station.  I'm meeting lotsa new people.  It's really great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah really.  I'm ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I mean, really?  Because I'm concerned for you, sweetheart.  I care about you.  I guess I miss you.  I'm sorry we split up.  I'm sorry I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're apologizing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it has been known.  C'mon Terri, I'm not that bad a guy.  I have regrets. I'd like to put things right.  Don't tell me you haven't thought about me. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... of course I have.  I've thought.  I've ... Oh, JP, you were so horrible.  You really hurt me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know.  It's bad.  I'm a bad person.  But I try not to be, Terri.  I really do.  And I really miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so good to hear, sweetheart.  It really is. You know, I .. are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good ... Good ... Look, why don't you come over?  You know, nothing heavy, little drink maybe, little talk.  Just see how we both feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  It'll be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Terri's face - we can almost see her summon the power to refuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No.  I can't.  I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the phone down quickly before he can persuade h She takes a couple of deep breaths and walks away from th phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Shit.  Shit.  Shit.  Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around.  She looks at the books.  She looks at videos.  She looks at the table.  She looks back at the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as it RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - shakes her head and turns the ansafone on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After two rings, the machine responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ansafone message) Hi.  You've reached Joanne Summerskill. In spirit at least.  Please leave a message.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hello.  Ms. Summerskill, this is Sharon Leech again from K-YZY in Monterey. Sorry to call so late but I was wondering if you got my other message? Look, I probably shouldn't say this on tape but what the hell ... there's a job here if you want it.  Late-night news reader.  We think you'd be marvelous ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine BEEPS and cuts her off, leaving the message l FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Terri's face - disappointed and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is still at the desk watching the bank of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirsty speaks, INTERCUT between Joey and the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looks to side)  Again?  (Shrugs. Looks back at camera)  The box.  I don't know where it came from.  I don't know who made it or why.  I only know what it does.  It hurts.  It hurts.   (Looks off to side as if listening.)  How?  (Looks back)  I don't know.  It kind of opens itself.  Your fingers move.  You learn. It wants to open, that's the thing.  And it knows when you want to open it.  And it helps.  And it opens.  And then they come.  The Cenobites.  The demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multiple images of Kirsty speaking those last few lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, one - and only one - of the monitors suffers a NOISE WIPE-OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey glances up at the one ghosting monitor, puzzled - an freezes in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as, on the one monitor, a new image suddenly appears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hazy, black-and-white image (very grainy, like early experimental TV images) of a thirtysomething man in early twentieth century military uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man - ELLIOTT - stares directly out of the monitor sc and, just as Kirsty finishes her last line ("The cenobite demons."), he speaks (in an English accent).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor) She's telling the truth, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BURST of WHITE NOISE and the image is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty is back on that monitor, just like all the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you can have me tell this ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey remains staring at the haunted monitor, numb with sh What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty's voice plays OFF as Joey stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  as often as you want.  There's not going to be any breakthrough.  You might think it's delusion, but it's not.  I saw them.  I looked into their eyes and they looked back at me.  Creatures from Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late-night coffee-shop in the early hours of the mornin Classic American Diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty booths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet counter.  A COP perches on a stool drinking coffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCKER in a booth by himself bites methodically on a d his eyes staring off into the vacancy of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner booth, FOUR KIDS nurse cokes and smoke cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black coffee sits by an ash-tray holding a burning ciga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - sitting at the table staring at the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits.  She takes a drag on the smoke.  She waits.  S sips her coffee.  She waits.  She looks up across the din

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double doors of the diner's entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back down at her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of doors opening OFF.  Terri looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALKING POV as somebody approaches Terri, whose face br into a nervous, ambiguous smile of welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as JP walks confidently to her table, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, babe.  Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP sits down opposite her.  He reaches over and pats her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey enters the unlit main room.  She glances across at t sofa.  It's unoccupied.  Joey puts the light on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grimaces at the chaos of the room - the piles of vide books - and crosses the room to the bedroom door.  She op the door and looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, we can't bunk up every night! People will ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom is empty, nobody on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) ... talk.  ... Terri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey leaves the door and walks back into the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around and then walks over to the phone.  Somet has caught her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand-scrawled note by the phone reads ENJOY MONTEREY, Y LIAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY registers the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey shakes her head sadly.  What can she do?  It's the e hours of the morning.  She has no idea where Terri is.  S walks back to the bedroom and closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick green jungle foliage obscures the view of a POV cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of confused battle are heard OFF; helicopters, fire, distant explosions, screams of the dying and the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves and branches SMACK against the frame as the unseen dreamer rushes confusedly through the dense forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices of the Soldiers - distant, echoed, repeated - heard over the roar of battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) He's going.  He's going.  He's going ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) We're losing him.  We're losing him. We're losing him ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of their voices seems to prompt the POV camera more furious endeavor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns rapidly left and right, forcing its way through greenery until suddenly, with one last push through folia thick enough to be a single bush, the view changes comple

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV camera (Joey) walks out into another battlefield, of a different character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be early morning.  The skies are grey and overcast.  In the distance plumes of black smoke spiral u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No jungle, no trees or grass.  The ground is baked mud disfigured with deep trenches, re-inforced by wooden slat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atmosphere is post-conflict; guns are silent, there a cries or sound of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered around are corpses of many khaki-clad soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing moves.  No birds sing.  It is a horrible, desolat image from the bloody pages of history.  The fields of Fl in World War One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise begins to be heard OFF.  A low angry BUZZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud of buzzing flies are feeding on the flesh of his dead face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Noooooooooo .......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzing and Joey's anguished cry both CONTINUE OVER a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sitting up in bed, eyes wide, still screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cry cuts off abruptly as Joey realizes where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches her breath and then freezes as she realizes t the buzzing sound from her dream is present in her bedroo Are the flies still feeding?  She glances around her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her TV set is on.  The buzzing sound comes from white noi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is puzzled and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is somebody here?  Is somebody here!? Terri ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She half gets out of bed and then stops, transfixed, as t screen's white noise is replaced by an image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in the editing suite, the image is grainy black-and-wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzing continues, now joined by HISSING and WHISTLIN fades in and out as if unseen hands are trying to tune in impossibly distant station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the sound-montage we can almost hear GHOSTLY VOICES whispering; "Joey, Joey, Joey ... "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, an English Officer - Elliott - is sitting legged on the floor of a Quonset hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor in front of him is something at which he sta something that the image is not sharp enough to show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear vies with fascination in Joey's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ... What's going on?  What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image disappears in a burst of STATIC which in turn i replaced by another image, still monochrome and grainy; A and-shoulders of Elliott, staring directly out of the scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of STATIC and the image disappears completely. Th is obviously not turned on.  The room is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stares at her dead TV in numbed silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls back into bed, pulling the covers protectively her, staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLICK is heard OFF and the room is lit, REVEALING JP by door, his finger by the light-switch.  He smiles into the and walks in, looking behind as Terri hesitates by the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri moves past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP locks the door with a key he draws from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri registers this.  JP calms her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a good neighborhood.  People disappear.  (a beat)  Feel like home? It's just like you left it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri moves into the room, glancing around herself cautio She registers the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's plainly different from the last time Terri saw it bu despite what the audience knows about it - it still seems inanimate; a black frozen carving, disturbing but harmles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite.  This wasn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But, as you can see, I'm having some work done on it.  You found a real treasure for me, Terri.  I hope I can show you how grateful I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... yeah, it looks different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a girl I know helped smarten it up.  Put her heart and soul into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl?  Anyone I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, no.  I mean - now that you're here, it's like she doesn't even exist, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
