dialogues.text: JP has been cruising the room as they speak.  Now he's st close to the pillar.  Terri is still some distance from h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.  Look ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, listen.    (a beat)   Why don't you come here and kiss me?  I mean, it's probably ticking away in both our minds, right?  Is it going to happen?  Isn't it going to happen?  Let's get it out of the way.  See how we feel.  Then we can relax.  Talk.  You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause - a tense one for the audience who know that JP h obviously decided who Pinhead's next meal is.  Terri look JP, half suspicious, half attracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  Not yet.  I'm not ready yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Sure.  I understand.  It's cool. I mean, we've got all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP smiles winningly and warmly.  A nice guy.  A nice smil smile a girl can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillar stands behind him, its dark inhabitant still a silent, waiting for the sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Series of shots (maybe all CROSS-FADED) of kids dancing a drinking in the club to establish the passing of time - a highlight the tension of the scene in JP's room by its proximity to this (relative) normality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP lounges against his wall, smoking, close to the pillar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri is sitting on the bed.  She's upset.  She's been te JP about Joey and the phone message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible.  What a bitch.  She was obviously just using you, Terri.  Ready to dump you the second she had what she needed, interfering little whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It isn't ... she wouldn't ... It's like I must have done something wrong, you know?  Freaked her out.  Just fucked up something good again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you didn't fuck it up with me.  You know that.  It was my fault, babe, it really was.  And you know I'm sorry. And I'm sorry to see you upset now.  I hate to see you in pain like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri looks up at him, her eyes vulnerable, on the verge tears.  She really wants to believe that he's being a nic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  God, yes.  I ... I just want to hug you.  To hold you.  To tell you it's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, the bastard's good at this.  Terri breaks into small and holds her arms out for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, sweetheart, you come to me. It's not fair.  I come over there.  You know.  We're on the bed.  I just ... 'cos you know how much you excite me. God, just looking at you.  You're so beautiful.  I come over there and I'd just want to touch you.  Feel you.  Kiss you.  And that isn't what this is about. C'mon, babe, come to daddy.  Let me make it better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri wipes her eyes, gives a small shy smile and stands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's walking toward JP.  And the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP puts a hand out.  He smiles.  Re-assuring.  Loving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri walks.  Vulnerable.  So in need of reassurance and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting closer ... closer ... closer ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as he blows it.  A sidelong glance at the pillar?  A su naked hunger in the smiling eyes?  A single bead of sweat Some tiny little thing that takes the lid off his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri stops dead.  She doesn't know what's happening but suddenly this doesn't feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ... Wait a ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP, smiling mask wiped off, leaps at Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri flings herself backward, screaming in shock and fea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead: suddenly animate and furious; eyes wide open, fa contorted in frustrated rage, black arms clawing at the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her to me, boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious, confused scene of tension and struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP has hold of Terri, trying to drag her to the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri fights back, screaming her disbelief and struggling kicking against him.  They are perilously close to the pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead is furious - roaring, tearing at the pillar with hands as if trying to physically rip himself. free of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, JP's size and strength is telling; Terri is being dragged nearer and nearer to the demon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last possible second - when it seems it's all over Pinhead's snatching fingers are centimeters from Terri's - Terri snatches up a heavy ornament from a shelf by the and smashes JP right across the head with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP collapses semi-conscious at the foot of the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri throws herself back from the monster's grabbing arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead snarls in frustration, hands clenched in fists of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri - safely feet away from the pillar - stands, shakin breathless, eyes wide in horror and shock as she stares a creature from nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly Pinhead changes tack; he slides from the roa beast of a moment before to his more usual persona - the articulate Black Pope of Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Why run?  Where to?  Do you know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're at the door of dreams.  And you can open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two keys in this room.  On is in the pocket of this fool.  You could take it out without me reaching you. (a beat)  Probably.  And you could use it to let yourself back in to the world you know.  The world you've always known; banal, hopeless, dreamless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead, as ever, is hitting the right buttons.  Terri, a know, has dreamed of dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ... like ... the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other is the key to dreams.  To a world of black miracles and dark wonder. Another life of unknown pleasures.  It's yours.  Complete the pattern.  Solve the puzzle.  Turn the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she looks at the monster.  And smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead returns the smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lying bleeding at your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP is on the floor, semi-conscious, bleeding from the hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delerious. Ad-lib) Unhhh ... Terri ... what ... no ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri edges around the pillar to grasp one of JP's limp a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as the bond between tempter and tempted is strengthened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri holds JP's arm out ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead stretches his own arm forward ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And JP finally - for one brief second of terrifying clari realizes what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No! Terri! Please! I didn't mean to..!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  Pinhead's hand closes around his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri leaps back out of harm's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead - with awesome strength - yanks JP up to his feet pulls him close.  He stares into the terrified face of JP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have such sights to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP is sucked dry by Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Terri watches, her face perversely excited by this - first of the dark miracles that the monster had promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as the transformation of pillar into Pinhead is complet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead, fully-fleshed and incarnate, stands in the room. his feet are the dry husk that was JP and the steaming, h remnants of the pillar like a pool of black toxic oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at Terri.  Slowly, elegantly, he walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri backs away across the room.  But she backs off slow sensuously, like an eager but nervous virgin bride ready her groom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera moves in CLOSE on her glowing eyes and excited fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the Box.  A cloud of dust spirals out into the r a reverse action of the dust in the antiques store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Joey's sleeping face.  REM shows beneath her eye and she murmurs in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very faintly OFF is the sound of distant music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's eyes snap open and glance from side to side.  She up in bed and registers the music, which seems to have gr volume on her waking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is strange, old-fashioned music;  A palm-court string orchestra playing a sentimental waltz tune reminiscent of 1920's or earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no-one in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV set is still dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But ... the bedroom door is open a crack and a very stran ORANGE LIGHT is creeping in from the main room.  And that to be from where the music is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she gets out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cautious and careful, moving slowly and quietly as wraps a robe around herself and moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door slowly and walks through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This room too is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is louder and the soft warm pulse of the orange is more distinct, bathing the walls and the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Joey tries to locate the source of the music and the light;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bookshelfs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV - with the still and inactive Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closed drapes over the big picture window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both the music and the light seem to be centered on the c door across the room.  They're both coming from behind it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey approaches the closet, still tense, still careful. opens the closet door and looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet is where Joey has stored her past.  But she's it neatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxed and piled on shelves are old magazines, old greetin cards, old photographs, old soft-toys, college diplomas, clippings from small-town newspapers ("Death of a Local H Tommy Summerskill lost in Vietnam", "Joanne Summerskill C Valedictorian: looks to career in Media") etc etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also in there, stuffed away at the top of the closet, is radio - a big old wood-and-wire-grille valve driven beaut which the lilting music is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At some stage in its life, part of its casing was smashed and the pulsing orange light is its flickering vacuum tub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an old mains-powered model and its mains cord dangle the shelf of the closet.  This radio isn't plugged into anything except the paranormal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Joey; staring at this broadcast from the beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey reaches up and brings the radio down from the shelf out into the main room.  She sets it down on the coffee t in front of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formal, classical framing from a low angle - Joey and rad foreground, big picture window and its closed drapes in t background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey kneels up in front of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the radio with the same kind of trapped fascination with which we have seen characters in the pre HELLRAISER movies stare at the Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fingers are drawn to the tuning dial as if to a puzzl She plays with the dial, moving through various "stations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's face is open with expectation as she moves through as if she is waiting for clues.  Or instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music gives way to various VOICES;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Indian voice giving some kind of commentary.  The Engl words "BBC" and "World Service" are heard amidst the punj

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Joey turns the dial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired sad English voice;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the King has sent a personal message of sympathy to the parents of those brave men who ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Joey turns the dial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A resonant French voice;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L'Oiseau chante avec ses doigts.  Deux fois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Joey turns the dial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another burst of music, this time more raucous and syncop A ragtime tune from the birth of Jazz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Joey turns the dial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead Air.  An ominous pause.  And Elliott's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey.  Look out your window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey shrinks back in nervous shock at this direct address

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio goes dead.  The tubes stop glowing.  The room i a dimly-lit place of shadow and suspense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey glances back over her shoulder at her closed drapes then at the silent radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up slowly and crosses to the drapes.  The came rises and TRACKS in as she walks, framing those drapes li curtains in a theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one strong gesture, Joey sweeps the drapes open.  An gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of neighboring roof-tops and a view of the city, is looking directly into the interior of a Quonset hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the image from her TV set though full-size, full-co and apparently real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end, Elliott sits cross-legged on the floor. front of him on the floor is the puzzle box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere in the hut; A camp-bed on which lie a gun-belt Officer's peaked cap.  And an old-fashioned radio - the s radio that is still in Joey's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she stares beyond her window into this impossible sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me ... Tell me ... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER on the elements in the hut, as we (and Joey) reali that everything in there is frozen in time.  There is no movement, no sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderingly (but carefully) Joey stretches her arm out be her.  When her arm reaches the threshold of the Quonset h disappears into the space once occupied by window glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her arm back sharply with an intake of breath. she even takes a half-step backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seven floors up ... I'm seven floors up! I can't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She summons her courage, steps over the sill, and walks i the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at a solid wall.  Then, through the wall, walks into the Hut, still bewilderment by the sights arou her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still the image does not move.  Everything is very real, present.  But frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey approaches the immobile Elliott and looks from him t box and back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NB: Joey's speeches to the frozen Elliott are bravado; h face and body language betray her awed nervousness at the bizarre situation in which she finds herself.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?  I'm here.  Now what?  I just walked into madness for you.  Talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey looks back behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no window back into the apartment, just a fourth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  That's just great!  You bring me here.  You freeze up on me.  And now there's no way out.  I've had dates like you before.  I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREAK is heard OFF.  Joey looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of the Quonset Hut, behind Elliott, a door creaked open an inch or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey looks from the door back to the frozen Elliott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey crosses to the door and opens it.  She walks through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey walks out onto the World War One battlefield of her recent dream.  She stands there - an incongruous vulnerab figure in her nightdress and robe - amidst the corpses, t trenches, and the distant plumes of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  Is this a dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances back at the door of the hut she has just left

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within the hut, the frozen Elliott still sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she turns from looking into the hut and gasps, her e wide in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on a hillock, framed against the grey battlefiel skies, is Elliott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott stands calmly and smiles at Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey.  How kind of you to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Joey (and the audience) take in Elliott's imposs presence, as she and he stand amidst the corpse-strewn fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait ... wait.  You ... you have to help me.  I don't understand.  Am I dreaming this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me.  You will understand.  And no, you're not dreaming.  Do you know where we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ... I don't know.  First World War, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.  The fields of France.  And many dead flowers ... Oh.  Forgive me. My name was Spenser.  Elliott Spenser. Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey - slowly and nervously - puts her hand out to shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey Summerskill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott smiles understandingly as he releases her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.  Brave girl.  You've probably never shaken hands with a ghost before, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Spenser.  Elliott.  I ... What the Hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell is precisely what is going on, Joey.  And we have to stop it.  I because of a special obligation, you because you're the only person who can help. And because you know what is right, and just, and true.  Will you walk with me a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures with his hand and they begin to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were days in this war, days right on top of each other, when the newly dead were numbered in the tens of thousands.  They called it the war to end all wars.  Though it didn't.  You know that.  There were more wars.  More dead.  Your father's war.  Your dream search for your father led you here.  To me.  Joey, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott does nothing dramatic - he doesn't clap his hands snap his fingers - but somehow, magically, he and Joey, w moving or changing position are back in the Quonset hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frozen Elliott is still sitting on the floor before t box.  The mobile Elliott gestures at his frozen self as h speaks to the bemused Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war pulled poetry out of some of us. Others it affected differently.  This is me a few years later.  We're in India, by the way, and it's 1921.  I was like many survivors. Lost souls with nothing left to believe in but gratification. We'd seen God fail, you see.  So many dead.  For us God, too, fell at Flanders.  We adjusted to the loss.  And if we mourned, we mourned in silence. Thousands drank themselves to death. Others went further.  I went further.  I thought I was a lost soul.  But, until this frozen moment, I didn't even know what the phrase meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is ... this frozen moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cusp of my life.  What I was, what I am, what I will be ... past, present, future, all bound here at this timeless moment of decision.  I was an explorer of forbidden vices and pleasures. Opening the Box was my final act of exploration, of discovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you discover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why are you back?  Why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, no signal from Elliott but the background changes magically once more;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott is once again framed dramatically on the hillock, standing close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because something worse is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I opened the Box, Joey.  I found the monster within it.  And it found the monster within me.  For decades I served Hell with no memory of my former life until a friend released me.  You saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty Cotton.  Yes.  But ... if your soul was freed, why are you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because - monster as I was - I was bound by Laws.  The protocol of Hell.  The Box had to be opened to let me out.  The truly innocent were safe.  That's no longer true.  The shell of the beast has been fleshed.  What I was is out there, Joey.  In your world.  Unbound. Unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will he do?  What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll do what he does best.  But he'll do it unfettered.  He wants to walk the Earth forever, indulging his taste for all the myriad subtleties of human suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Joey.  You ask all the right questions.  There is something we can do but it will require great courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott reaches out and strokes her cheek.  Gently.  Lovi We see in Joey's eyes that there is a response there.  A response beyond the comradely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, you walked through your window from one reality to another.  You're stronger than you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his first night on Earth.  He wants to close the door behind him. Like all Lieutenants, he covets command. There's a gateway to Hell through which he can be taken back.  He has to destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Box, Joey.  He wants the Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flash.  Music pounds.  Kids dance.  It's a wild ni Under The Underground and it's about to get wilder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The source music (thrash metal) builds and builds, as if heading for a climax.  And then the climax comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door BLASTS open explosively from within.  The pieces the shattered door FLY across the dance-floor, accompanie chunks of plaster and brick from the door-surround.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying wood and masonry hit people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One chunk SMASHES into the DJ console, bringing the music scratching, screeching end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various SCREAMS are heard OFF through the ensuing silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the confusion, kids scramble for the main doorway.  Is bomb?  Is it a street-gang attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Main Doorway SLAMS supernaturally shut, bolts flying place untouched by human (or inhuman) hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused and frightened faces turn back to look at the so of the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit from behind by blinding beams of BLUE LIGHT, Pinhead emerges through the doorway.  Slow.  Elegant.  Terrifying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead surveys the scene before him and the terrified an struck crowd look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the most part, the crowd are stunned into silence but are a few murmurs from them;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad-lib) Oh My God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the FUCK ... ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no no no no ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead scans the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the terrified humans.  The cruelly beautiful artworks.  The humans.  The artworks.  The humans.  The artworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small smile forms on his face.  He's just had an entert idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view through the big picture window is entirely norma again; the cityscape by night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Joey seems to appear behind the glass - translu like a reflection - and comes through the window into her apartment, "solidifying" as she steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hands are at her head and she staggers forward a few It's as if the enormity of her trip thru realities has ju her.  She falls forward onto the floor of her room, uncon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as the ringing of a phone grows in volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey raises her head, bleary-eyed, and glances round the trying to locate the source of the noise that has woken h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls the few feet to the phone and snatches at it. hand-set falls and she has to gather it up from the floor Maneuvering herself into a sitting position, she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) You wanted a story.  You got it.  Turn on the TV now.  And then get your ass down here ... (click) ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc?  ...  Doc ... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the phone down and rushes across to turn on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The images are confusing, with the rapid pans and tempora loss of focus or light that characterise raw news footage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc's Camera weaves amongst a mass of uniformed people, t to catch clear pictures of-what's been happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirens howl, red emergency lights flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It becomes clear we are looking at the aftermath of a dis Or a massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club building looks like a bomb hit it.  Smoke and de litter the street.  So do corpses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the dead bodies are simply dead bodies.  Others - glimpsed fleetingly and tantalizingly as Doc is jostled a bustled - seem to be mutilated decoratively.  In fact the hideous similarities to the artworks that used to grace t club: armless torsos wrapped in barbed wire; flayed limbs machinery inside instead of muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) Judas Priest!  Will you look at ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the images are blocked by a very BURLY COP push the camera and talking directly into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it!  Now!  No pictures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off) W-QQY.  I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit!  Move it or lose it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Joey's face as she reacts in horror to what she seeing.    (INTERCUT with Doc's footage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it's happening ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc's camera pans around the area, past rubbernecking cro past shadowed alleys, past Police cars and ambulances veh ... and then whips back to an alley in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought ... what's ... I think there's something up there ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's eyes widen in horror as she speaks uselessly to th screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No, Doc, don't ... don't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hubbub and noise has died away.  Doc's camera is adva up a very dimly-lit alley.  Hardly any detail can be seen camera creeps forward ... forward ... forward ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly a barely-glimpsed movement very close to th and the camera swings wildly toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  What was ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face of Pinhead, almost lost to the darkness of the a is glimpsed on the screen as it looms toward the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image disappears to darkness, over which Doc's SCREAM mortal terror and agony can be heard before the blackness suddenly replaced by a station identification card and th very harried anchorperson at a studio desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've ... er ... yes, we've temporarily lost our pictures there and ... and ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey has her hands at her mouth in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc!  DOC!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey leaps to her feet, grabs the box from the TV, and st at it in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's hands grip her steering-wheel tightly.  Her face i drawn and grim.  The Box is on the seat beside her. She i driving very fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to slam on the brakes at a red light.  She pounds the dashboard in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a terrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face belongs to EDDIE, a 20 year old runner for a dru gang.  His head is pressed tight against a brick wall.  H nose is bleeding and his eye is red and ready to bruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it!  I promise!  I'll ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fist slams into Eddie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alley.  Eddie is being held against the wall by two uniformed COPS, one in his 40's, one in his 20's.  The el cop has just punched Eddie in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't promise me shit, you little fuck! You know what your promise is worth to me?  Huh?  Fifty per cent of fuck-all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the money, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big back-handed slap from the Elder Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the money, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to me, Please!  I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Cop gut-punches him and Eddie doubles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done listening, shit-brain!  Where you been all day?  They shut the school? Kindergarten closed?  No customers? Huh?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the money, Eddie.  Tell ya, I'm gonna puke if he beats on you any more. Just give him the ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Younger Cop pauses, looking beyond them down the alle long black shadow falls over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... money.  What the ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Cop, at the change in his partner's tone, looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the center of the alley at its far end, light coming from behind him so that he is unclear, is Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calm. Expecting obedience) You, fuckoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your head outta your stinkin' ass and look at me, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking down alley) Hey ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead is moving up the alley towards the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elder Cop shoves Eddie away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie) Get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie doesn't waste time with questions.  He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops straighten up and start walking to meet Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead advances- still in the shadows, still just a blac shape moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the distinct impression I told you to fuckoff.  Unless I miss my guess, you've just disobeyed an officer of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead emerges into the (dim) light in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops halt in shock at this awesome presence, both of them instinctively drawing their guns.  And both instinctively beginning to back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one butt-ugly son of a bitch and you're about to dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the son of eternal night and you are about to discover pain has no ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's enough of a direct threat for any officer of law.  Both cops fire their guns.  Once.  Twice.  Three ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead keeps walking.  He spits out the bullets that his has absorbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shh ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They empty their guns - useless - and then they turn and down the alley.  And then stop short.  There is a sudden of impenetrable blackness in front of them as if the worl simply comes to a stop four yards from their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops turn, terrified, to look back.  Instinctively, t spread apart - each walking near to opposite walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The younger cop is standing beneath a fire escape.  He gl up as if he might be able to jump up to safety.  No.  Too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead's head flicks upward as if in a gesture of comman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Fire escape ladder zooms downward with impo speed and force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Younger Cop doesn't even have time to scream.  The la smashes right through his body, impaling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His corpse stands there twitching and shuddering, wrapped around the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elder Cop stares in terror at his partner's fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  No.  No.  No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead stands very still and speaks very calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curb your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Cop's body starts to move involuntarily.  His movements are jerky and spasmodic as if his mind is tryin fight what his body is trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead's head moves through various positions.  His face calm, showing no particular pleasure at what he is doing only a fascinated concentration as if experimenting with found skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Copts shaking puppet-like hands draw his handcu from his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes show terror.  Everything else is beyond his cont

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the cuffs to head level and springs one of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mouth suddenly jerks open and his tongue protrudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fear in his eyes increases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves the open cuff over his tongue.  He's making pani moaning noises as if trying to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM!  He drives the cuff closed right through his tongue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And SCREAMS (as best he can).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead looks beyond the Cop to the wall of blackness and another commanding gesture with his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chain flies from the darkness and wraps itself around t other cuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain pulls taut and then suddenly retracts into the darkness, hauling the Cop off his feet and dragging him a the alley into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop screams and moans all the way until he is envelop into the darkness and then the sounds suddenly stop dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Paramedic is attempting to hold Joey back.  In the dist behind them is the wreckage of the club.  They are standi near the alley into which Doc's camera disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to see him!  I'm his friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, trust me!  You really don't want to go ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joey has slipped past his obstructing arm and runs on the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pulls to a horrified stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  NO!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene is well-lit by Police emergency lights.  It is off by yellow DO NOT CROSS banners.  Paramedics and cops around in various states of shock or disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of it all is Doc.  Quite dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body is kneeling up, its cold hands resting on its la holding its severed head which stares up at its shoulders camera has been shoved deep between the corpse's shoulder blades and is angled down as if filming its dead face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Joey's devastated face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An establishing shot of a church at the top of a small hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Church is in semi-darkness.  Some candles at an offer some others on an altar, provide the only light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the very front pew a PRIEST sits, head bent low in pra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest is a young man.  Probably a good man.  We're n really going to have the time to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow seems to pass over the Priest's bowed head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, it seems he hasn't noticed.  Then he looks up, little puzzled.  He looks to his right, his left, then sh in the pew to look back along the central aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are rows and rows of empty pews and, in the distanc Church door ... which is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest stands, walks to the start of the aisle, and l back along it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling down aisle) Is there anyone there?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest looks puzzled.  We see his mind work.  He's lo right, looked left, looked down ... How about ...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns right round to face the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Priest, it's an image of nightmarish blasphemy.  E us heathens, it's pretty shocking;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead in all his dark glory is standing behind the alta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse.  Pinhead, staring at the Priest all the wh reaches his hand to the back of his head and begins to ex one of the pins from his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pin is horribly long and, sickeningly, the last few i aren't metal at all but some kind of infernal worm - dark slimy, and befanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead presses the worm against his palm and it instantl burrows through his flesh pulling its pin-tail behind it. repeats the operation with the other palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his palms out to show the Priest in a blasphemou parody of Christ's stigmata.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest rushes up to the altar to Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll burn in Hell for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest reaches him.  Pinhead's hand is on his throat instantly, squeezing silence from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn?  What a limited imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choking Priest kicks and struggles as Pinhead forces his knees before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead towers over the Priest.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his free hand he gouges out a piece of his own flesh the decorative wounds on his chest.  He holds the bloody of meat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my body.  This is my blood. Happy are they who come to my supper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead shoves the disgusting lump of blue and bloody fle into the Priest's aghast mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead flings the priest away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest lands heavily on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead walks forward, smashing the altar aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the candles flicker as if an unheard wind is blowing through the Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead walks up the aisle toward the semi-conscious Prie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the candles go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is driving again.  And this time she's not even stop at red lights.  She steams across junctions, leaving cars swerving and horns honking in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches her eye and she throws a glance to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) Oh God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up a side street, atop a hill, is the Inner-city Church. on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey swings the car up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey getting out of the car nearer the burning church.  O her side is a smaller building, the Church Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey shakes her head at the desecration.  She has no doub who's responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having fun en route, you bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a CREAKING noise from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey freezes in terror then slowly - very slowly - turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest - now mercifully dead - is crucified against t side wall of the smaller building.  Pinhead's nails protr from his palms and his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES of QUICK CUTS of Joey's car tearing through the darkness heading back to her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey rushes down the corridor to her apartment door, hurr turns the lock and rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey closes her door and switches on the light.  The mood suddenly different after the frenzied drive across town. very still, very slow, very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's too quiet:  Joey moves into the room slowly, clutching the Box in her hands and glancing round.  Her m makes the mood suddenly creepy.  Is the monster already i house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very slowly, very carefully, Joey begins to move round he apartment.  Hardly breathing, making no sudden movements, checks her doors.  The kitchen ... empty.  The bedroom .. empty.  The bathroom ... empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stands back in the center of her main room, facing o her big picture window.  Slowly, she lets out a big breat then draws an equally slow one in.  Maybe it's alright .. maybe the monster isn't here ... maybe ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magically, eerily, slowly, the Box begins to rise from Jo hand.  Her eyes stare in horror as it ascends through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's one place she hasn't checked.  Swallowing nervously, Joey tilts her head up and back, her eyes risi in their sockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera tilts low ... low ... lower ... taking in a wi view of the room and its ceiling and the ascending Box ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the audience screams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a spider or a lizard, Pinhead is flat against the ce arms stretched out for balance, his face staring down at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey throws her hands to her mouth and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead, angling down feet first, floats elegantly to the to stand facing Joey.  The Box lands in one of his outstr hands.  He holds it out to show Joey ... and then suddenl closes his powerful hand on it, apparently crushing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flings the remnants from him and they land on Joey's f Chunks and splinters of wood, whirring and spinning machi of gold and silver, and scores of tiny writhing worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to the miracles of trick photography, the remnants suddenly come back together and reassemble themselves int Box which sits there intact on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Box can't be destroyed.  Like pain or the poor, it is always with us.  But as long as I have it, no-one can open it.  Now come here and die.  You have friends in Hell waiting to greet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey begins to back across the room toward her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to come and get me, you ugly bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spirited.  Good.  I'll enjoy making you bleed.  I'll enjoy making you enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead starts across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey looks at her window.  It's the normal view ... with normal seven-story drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bites her lip, goes for it: in a literal and metaphor leap of faith she runs headlong at the window and jumps a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead's arm reaches out after Joey as if to grab her an her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - shows his arm entering the shattered window and also sh the night-time cityscape beyond the window.  What it does show is the front of the monster's arm.  That's somewhere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Pinhead's arm, still clutching at the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a khaki-uniformed arm moves into shot and grasp Pinhead's hand, arm-wrestling style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott literally pulls Pinhead through from one reality another - we see parts of the monster appearing and disappearing in front of the Hut wall as if glimpsed thro tears in reality.  It's like a tug-of-war which Elliott w Suddenly Pinhead's there on the floor of the Quonset hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his other self - Elliott - still has hold of his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead throws a glance around the Hut.  He recognizes it and the frozen figure at the top end perched before the B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious rage) Aahhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!  Back to the wall, quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey runs around then to the far wall - just in time beca now the pyrotechnics start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott tightens his grip and (with a nice series of INTE CLOSE-UPS of these two alternative selves) the life-force Elliott and Pinhead begin to erupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELECTRIC BLUE LIGHT begins to play over both their bodies It's apparently agonizing, both figures arching with the both faces grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey watches, wincing in sympathetic agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott!  No!  What about you?!  Where will you be?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott grunts his answer through the agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with the damned.  No more hope of heaven.  But I drag this monster back with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid interfering foo ... AAAAAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The essences of Pinhead and Elliott - drawn from their bo as sweeping, glowing, spitting arcs of BLUE LIGHT - crack the air of the Hut like a miniature electrical storm ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until they suddenly lock together in one more powerful ar which flies at the body of the seated Officer and disappe inside him in a BLINDING FLASH OF LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, as vision returns, there is only the seated officer   (and, at the far end of the room, Joey).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, almost as suddenly, the frozen scene comes to life;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio near the camp bed is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bead of sweat falls down the Officer's face as he reach forward to pick up the Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer, apparently completely unaware of Joey's pres begins to work the Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the process works through, we INTERCUT CONSTANTLY BETW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1)  The Officer's hands and the movements of the Box here the Hut in 1921.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2)  EXACTLY MATCHING movements of the Box back on the flo Joey's apartment in 1992.  Moving on its own, linked acro years to its earlier self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3)  Joey watching the movements in the Hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott? ... Elliott? ... You can't hear me, can you?  It's 1921.  I'm not really here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, small patterns of BLUE LIGHT arc across the Box shocking the Officer who drops the Box and then stares in and fascination as ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, the box begins to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer kneels up and leans over the Box ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the chains fly!  Shooting up from within and hooking themselves cruelly into the Officer's face and chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the Officer's face, howling in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Joey's face, sobbing in distress.  She throws up hands to hide the unbearable sight from herself and, when lowers them, ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. she's back in her room. Alone.  Window intact.  Normal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stares around, her face a mix of sadness and relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood now is very down, post-cataclysmic, post-adventu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes a deep slow breath and crosses the room toward kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses the floor without glancing down at it.  Why s she?  Everything's over.  But we notice, even if she does that the Box is no longer there.  But we hardly have time register this before ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey opens the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SCREAMS!!!!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead is framed in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, instead of her kitchen, is the black space of - like the Torture Rooms in HELLRAISER and HELLBOUND, it full of shadowy pillars and chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no kiss of welcome after 70 years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey backs away, shaking her head in shocked denial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead moves forward, very leisurely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be so good, Joey.  You loved him, didn't you?  I can feel him inside, weeping for you.  He can watch through the centuries as we discover the things that make you whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's mood breaks and she turns and rushes for her front

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches it, throws it open ... and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP Monroe is in the doorway - but he's only just recogniz He's now a CENOBITE - blue-skinned, scarred, mutilated, a decorated with metal and leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never met, did you?  This was JP Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen what they did to me?  Have you seen what they did?  You interfering little whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JP Cenobite moves into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, now near hysteria, rushes across the room again to one remaining door - her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws that one open ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Terri, the new FEMALE CENOBITE, walks out at her.  Sh the open Box in her hand and several cigarette protruding different holes in her cheek and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri?  Oh no!  NO!!  TERRI!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go on.  Have one.  Fuck it.  You think you're going to live forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinhead and JP are advancing across the room toward Joey Terri.  Joey only has seconds to act ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna light, you bitch?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey pulls her father's Zippo from her pocket and sparks as she swings it through the air close to Terri's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge FLAME shoots out of the Zippo (as in the earlier s and scours across Terri's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri howls in terror, throws her hands to her face ... a Box flies from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey catches it, spins it, closes it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arc of BLUE LIGHT zaps across to Terri and she's gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in one movement, swinging on her heels, Joey twists box again ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another Arc of LIGHT zaps JP away ...
